javadoc:
Interface for a set of data fields that represent one indexable set of information
 in the model. The fields in a layout are arranged into rows.  The height of the
 row is the height of the tallest field in that row.  Each field contains one or
 more lines of text.

methods.javadoc: Returns the total height of this layout.
methods.name: getHeight
methods.comment: Returns the total height of this layout.

methods.name: getPrimaryOffset
methods.comment:
Returns the vertical offset (in pixels) of the start of the primary
 field in the layout.

return.comment: -1 if layout does not have a primary field.

methods.javadoc:
Inserts empty space above the layout
@param size the amount of space to insert above the layout
methods.name: insertSpaceAbove
methods.comment: Inserts empty space above the layout

params.name: size
params.comment: the amount of space to insert above the layout

methods.javadoc:
Inserts empty space below the layout
@param size the amount of space to insert below the layout
methods.name: insertSpaceBelow
methods.comment: Inserts empty space below the layout

params.name: size
params.comment: the amount of space to insert below the layout

methods.javadoc: Returns the number of Fields in this Layout.
methods.name: getNumFields
methods.comment: Returns the number of Fields in this Layout.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the i'th Field in this Layout.
@param index the index of the field to retrieve.
methods.name: getField
methods.comment: Returns the i'th Field in this Layout.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index of the field to retrieve.

methods.name: paint
methods.comment: Paints this layout on the screen.

params.name: g
params.comment: The graphics context with which to paint.

params.name: context
params.comment: contains various information needed to do the paint

params.name: rect
params.comment: the screen area that needs to be painted.

params.name: layoutColorMap
params.comment: indicates where the selection exists

params.name: cursorLocation
params.comment: the location of the cursor or null if the cursor is not in this layout

methods.name: setCursor
methods.comment:
Sets the cursor to the given point location.  The cursor will be positioned
 to the row column position that is closest to the given point.

params.name: cursorLoc
params.comment: the location that is to be filled in.

params.name: x
params.comment: the x coordinate of the point to be translated into a cursor location.

params.name: y
params.comment: the y coordinate of the point to be translated into a cursor location.

return.comment: the x coordinated of the computed cursor location.

methods.name: getCursorRect
methods.comment: Returns a rectangle which bounds the given cursor position.

params.name: fieldNum
params.comment: the index of the field containing the cursor position.

params.name: row
params.comment: the the text row in the field containing the cursor position.

params.name: col
params.comment: the character position in the row containing the cursor position.

methods.name: cursorUp
methods.comment: Moves the cursor up one row from its current position.

params.name: cursorLoc
params.comment: the cursor location object to be modified

params.name: lastX
params.comment: the x coordinate of the cursor before the move.

return.comment: true if the cursor was successfully moved up without leaving the layout.

methods.name: cursorDown
methods.comment: Moves the cursor up down row from its current position.

params.name: cursorLoc
params.comment: the cursor location object to be modified

params.name: lastX
params.comment: the x coordinate of the cursor before the move.

return.comment: true if the cursor was successfully moved down without leaving the layout.

methods.name: cursorBeginning
methods.comment: Sets the given FieldLocation as far to the left as possible.

params.name: cursorLoc
params.comment: the cursor location object to be modified.

return.comment: the x coordinate of the cursor after the operation.

methods.name: cursorEnd
methods.comment: Sets the given FieldLocation as far to the right as possible.

params.name: cursorLoc
params.comment: the cursor location object to be modified.

return.comment: the x coordinate of the cursor after the operation.

methods.name: cursorLeft
methods.comment:
Sets the given FieldLocation one position to the left.  If already at the
 left most position, it tries to move to the end of the previous row.

params.name: cursorLoc
params.comment: the cursor location object to be modified.

return.comment:
the x coordinate of the cursor after the operation.  Returns -1 if
 it was already at the top, left most position.

methods.name: cursorRight
methods.comment:
Sets the given FieldLocation one position to the right.  If already at the
 right most position, it tries to move to the beginning of the next row.

params.name: cursorLoc
params.comment: the cursor location object to be modified.

return.comment:
the x coordinate of the cursor after the operation.  Returns -1 if
 it was already at the bottom, right most position.

methods.name: enterLayout
methods.comment: Tries to move the cursor into this layout.

params.name: cursorLoc
params.comment: the field location to hold new location.

params.name: lastX
params.comment: the last valid x coordinate.

params.name: fromTop
params.comment: true if entering from the above this layout

return.comment: true if the cursor successfully moves into this layout.

methods.name: getScrollableUnitIncrement
methods.comment: Returns the amount to scroll to reveal the line of text.

params.name: topOfScreen
params.comment:
the y coordinate that represents the top or bottom of
 the screen

params.name: direction
params.comment: the direction to scroll

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the the given yPos lies within this layout.
@param yPos the vertical coordinate to check if in this layout.
methods.name: contains
methods.comment: Returns true if the the given yPos lies within this layout.

params.name: yPos
params.comment: the vertical coordinate to check if in this layout.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the bounds of the given field (in coordinates relative to the layout)
@param index the field id for the field for which to get bounds
methods.name: getFieldBounds
methods.comment: Returns the bounds of the given field (in coordinates relative to the layout)

params.name: index
params.comment: the field id for the field for which to get bounds

methods.javadoc: Returns the number of indexes consumed by this layout.
methods.name: getIndexSize
methods.comment: Returns the number of indexes consumed by this layout.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the smallest possible width of this layout that can display its full contents
@return the smallest possible width of this layout that can display its full contents
methods.name: getCompressableWidth
methods.comment: Returns the smallest possible width of this layout that can display its full contents

return.comment: the smallest possible width of this layout that can display its full contents

name: Layout
comment:
Interface for a set of data fields that represent one indexable set of information
 in the model. The fields in a layout are arranged into rows.  The height of the
 row is the height of the tallest field in that row.  Each field contains one or
 more lines of text.
